comments.body: you mentioned this one was added before ansible 2.8. so any alias to link old name to guarantee backward  compatibility?
I will check that one... and when we decide to merge we will see how the documentation looks like. I don't know if we could somehow see the doc on the pr branch?
perhaps i should ask @felixfontein to take a look if there's anything else that needs to be done here.

added note with link in the documentation.
now we are in-line with renaming procedure.
also the link to module has  "_" in the front to mark module as obsolete.

Sorry for replying so late. You've already added a note, that's IMO always a good idea. Two things you could also do:
 1. add a deprecation warning which is emitted whent the old module name is used, and which tells the user the new name to use;
 2. add an entry into the porting guide.

Both don't seem to be mandatory; I've always used 1. before, but never 2. for renames, though @gundalow recently recommended 2. in some discussion. For 1., see https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/modules/crypto/acme/acme_account_info.py#L130-L131 for how this can be done.

By having the deprecation link, an alias will already be added to the docs page; see [here](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/modules/acme_account_info_module.html#synopsis). This is added because of the symlink.
that it will be deprecated in Ansible 2.12

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +213,217 @@
        if self.module._name == 'azure_rm_virtualmachine_extension':
            self.module.deprecate("The 'azure_rm_virtualmachine_extension' module has been renamed to 'azure_rm_virtualmachineextension'", version='2.12')

        resource_group = None
